title: I need help
body:
So i have been playing for 10months now, i thought that meant id be experienced (came from first person shooters and forza on 360 to playing league) 
But then i have been placed in b5 at the start of year, makes sense coz i was very bad had no knowledge, never had guidence, i have recently tried to climb again about 2months ago i started using kennen stuck with him and have a decent win rate etc i got to b4 was very happy games where i didnt carry well enough so got demoted, i have a 2nd account XxEvo8xX i started this account as i feel im far better than b5, i got s4 in promos played a few games after didnt win them but still have normal mmr for s4 due to having 1380mmr which is only average which kinda sucks as i feel after a year of trying my best im only average or even below average, i know i can carry my self out of bronze 5 as i did it, i can win lane pretty much every game, but i dont know how to carry feeding team mates who dont listen or get objectives (not blaming them for my losses) 
The problem is i dont know where im not good enough, or lacking skill or knowledge I understand some games just cant be won, but the rest i should be able to carry right? I need to improve i just dont know where, can anyone help?

replies.body:
I'm bronze 5 as well, so don't take my advice heavily, as it's probably incorrect xD

I think while Kennen can carry, he cant really hard carry. Yeah, he can do tons of dmg when ahead, but he can't really get in their backline and 1v3 the enemy's squishies. That's just an example, but in general find a champion that when ahead can literally solo carry a team of feeders.

Personally, I main Nasus and I feel like because I'm experienced with him, I can easily solo carry a "not so good team" cough cough feeders cough. He, in my opinion, is a hard carry because he has such good damage late game whilst not having to build any damage items.

Of course I could be completely wrong. You could be a Kennen God, who will one day overtake Faker as SKT's mid laner, but your just getting terrible teams. I know that feeling by the way, I too feel like I deserve more than Bronze 5, it's just I get let down sometimes by teammates who just love dieing! Also, something I have learnt is that it's perfectly fine to blame a team or teammate for a loss in ranked, just don't become toxic, because then you will tilt and play worse in future games.

Best of luck with getting out of bronze man, hope I helped :)

I feel nasus is not really a hard carry since he hasn't got much early pressure and if the enemy team has a teemo, darius, vayne, zilean, ect. they don't have to be good to shut you down before you can do anything. Try pantheon if you want to hard carry, since he has alot of map pressure and he's really good at ending the game pre20min. Riven and Fiora are also hard carry if you can play them properly. I can't because I'm bronze 5 and I have the mechanical skill of a potato but these are statistically the best hard carry toplaners and are the preferred choices of boosters.
I main mid not top, mid to s far better for carrying as easy roam top or bott
Plus i hate tanks by the time its late game generally my team has fed the enemy too much for me go be useful
I was just saying pantheon since he mentioned a top laner. But all in all pantheon, riven, fiora, vayne, leesin, fizz, ekko and zed are all popular champions for boosters.

Yeah I agree.

I wrote that at like 12 last night and now that I look back at it I'm like "wtf was I thinking" lmao

Well I'm not sure where to really start since everyone has a specific area that hinders them from climbing or such. In couple of Nightblue3's video shows him coaching so go on youtube and search it and listen in.
Cheers, i will have a look

Hey xXEvolution7Xx,

It's always hard to have these conversation with people, because sometimes the answer is- that's where you belong. 

I'm a diamond 5 support main, who used support to carry all the way from bronze 1.  I'll try and give you some general tips though. 

* Champion counter picks aren't as important as people think they are. Knowing your champion is so much better than picking a counter pick. 
* Play a small pool of champions. Get to know 2-3 champions in the 2 roles you're queuing for. [Feasibly 2 champions in your primary and 1 in your secondary]. 
* Never criticise your teammates. I know you probably hear this one a lot, but it makes a huge difference. Comebacks from behind when people on your team are raging are so small. If your team works together? So easy. 

It appears that your winrate and KDA on Kennen are solid- which tells me you know him really well. I'd recommend just solo grinding him in all your games [It seems like the other champions you play are what is bringing you down].

Hope that somewhat helps!

Yeah i know what you mean, but i have a 2nd account that is silver 4 i play on which isnt too bad, but for some reason climbing out of bronze 5 is hard, which makes no sense to me like i can win lane easy just carrying my team is hard, i can roam and get objectives but its no good when people solo or feed to no end dont farm or ward or communicate etc etc (not saying im perfect, nor blaming them for my losses but they certainly make it harder) 
At the start of games i mute everyone to save the hassle of toxic people, 
Yeah as i said the champions i previously played where when i was probably at a b5 standard as i had little game knowledge and experience, kennen is basically the start of me trying ranked again as i got dis heartened by being b5 but i see why i was b5 
Thank you for advice i didnt know counter picks didnt matter, although it is b5 :') 
But i generally just go kennen mid as no one bans him unless troll on my team and bans them other than that i just use him to climb out of bronze
if you can knock down top tower quick have good cs roam mid and take tower. prioritize the objectives as this is what will put your team ahead and its important that you never surrender
I main mid not top, but yeah i do roam and take objectives problem is most the time the enemy gets a much great gold lead from other lanes not always but some times
Ill take a look at your games and get back to you.

Oh also before you get the wring idea, i dont play ranked to win 1v5 i try to help my team out, i want to be more valuable to my team as some game i feel im not helping them enough so we loose :/ maybe im just to full of my self im not really sure hence why im here
